## Description {#details}

Class to build a trie of call stack contexts for a particular profiled allocation call, along with their associated allocation types.

The allocation will be at the root of the trie, which is then used to compute the minimum lists of context ids needed to associate a call context with a single allocation type.

Definition at line 53 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memoryprofileinfo-h">MemoryProfileInfo.h</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### addCallStack() {#a87d4df64225248afbae4f68c4f9501b1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void CallStackTrie::addCallStack (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a230980cf62b697d22ffdda32f6118e27">AllocationType</a> AllocType, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; uint64&#95;t &gt; StackIds, std::vector&lt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/contexttotalsize">ContextTotalSize</a> &gt; ContextSizeInfo=&#123;&#125;)</>}>
Add a call stack context with the given allocation type to the Trie.

The context is represented by the list of stack ids (computed during matching via a debug location hash), expected to be in order from the allocation call down to the bottom of the call stack (i.e. callee to caller order).

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memoryprofileinfo-h/#l00119">119</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memoryprofileinfo-h">MemoryProfileInfo.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memoryprofileinfo-cpp/#l00139">139</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memoryprofileinfo-cpp">MemoryProfileInfo.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### addSingleAllocTypeAttribute() {#a93eab9244b86ce5f52aa4f15a71741be}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void CallStackTrie::addSingleAllocTypeAttribute (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase">CallBase</a> &#42; CI, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a230980cf62b697d22ffdda32f6118e27">AllocationType</a> AT, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Descriptor)</>}>
Add an attribute for the given allocation type to the call instruction.

If hinted by reporting is enabled, a message is emitted with the given descriptor used to identify the category of single allocation type.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memoryprofileinfo-h/#l00138">138</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memoryprofileinfo-h">MemoryProfileInfo.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memoryprofileinfo-cpp/#l00296">296</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memoryprofileinfo-cpp">MemoryProfileInfo.cpp</a>.

### buildAndAttachMIBMetadata() {#ab9f10c4267af88a1bd143a7260d2ac8f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool CallStackTrie::buildAndAttachMIBMetadata (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase">CallBase</a> &#42; CI)</>}>
Build and attach the minimal necessary MIB metadata.

If the alloc has a single allocation type, add a function attribute instead. The reason for adding an attribute in this case is that it matches how the behavior for allocation calls will be communicated to lib call simplification after cloning or another optimization to distinguish the allocation types, which is lower overhead and more direct than maintaining this metadata. Returns true if memprof metadata attached, false if not (attribute added).

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memoryprofileinfo-h/#l00133">133</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memoryprofileinfo-h">MemoryProfileInfo.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memoryprofileinfo-cpp/#l00313">313</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memoryprofileinfo-cpp">MemoryProfileInfo.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
